meanings.definition: A person who appeases or placates someone by giving in to their demands.
meanings.sent1: The appeaser always gave in to his friend's demands to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was known as an appeaser because she always gave extra time for assignments.
meanings.sent3: The appeaser at the office party kept bringing snacks to keep everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: She was an appeaser, constantly bending to others' wishes like a flexible branch in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The appeaser's constant need to please others made him popular but exhausted.

meanings.definition: To pacify or placate someone by giving in to their demands.
meanings.sent1: He would appease his little sister by letting her play with his toys.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to appease the angry customer by offering a refund.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to appease the picky eater by adding extra cheese to the dish.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing words were like a magic spell, able to appease any upset child.
meanings.sent5: The apology was meant to appease the hurt feelings, but it only made things worse.
